2.83.text:
Today I’ve donned my 2nd Doctor costume
because I’m doing the Doctor Who tag for

6.25.text:
no other reason apart from the fact that I
really just want to talk about Doctor Who again.

9.54.text: Question 1: Who is your favourite Doctor?

11.64.text:
My favourite Doctor is the 11th Doctor. The
thing I love most about the 11th Doctor is

15.08.text:
he really is an old man in a young man’s
body. That phrase has often been used to describe

18.16.text:
him and it couldn’t be more accurate. The
actor who plays the 11th Doctor, Matt Smith

21.35.text:
is the younger actor to ever play the role.
But his choice to not play it like that and

25.07.text:
play it as if he really is a man who is 900
years old but stuck in this really young body is inspired.

31.20.text: Question 2: What is your favourite Doctor Who story?

33.60.text: My favourite story is still the 2-part story,

35.56.text:
The Impossible Astronaut and Day of the Moon.
This was the first story of Matt Smith’s

38.80.text:
second season of playing the Doctor and without
having to introduce a new actor playing the

42.41.text:
Doctor or a new actor playing his companions
it could really focus on telling an amazingly

46.51.text:
great story. A statement made by Steven Moffat,
the writer of these episodes said that he

50.39.text:
wanted a season opener that felt like a series
finale. He completely succeeds in this but

54.73.text:
that’s not the main reason I like it. What
I love most about this story, specifically

57.50.text:
the first part, The Impossible Astronaut,
is the feeling that the show is reinventing

61.82.text:
itself. This was an episode that was taking risks with
the structure of the show. Changing the building

65.89.text:
blocks of what the show was about. Changing
vital information about certain characters.

69.47.text:
But I think the fact that it's this big, mad,
scary, awesome Doctor Who story that manages

73.72.text:
to have all these reinvention elements in
it and succeed is why I adore it so much.

77.87.text:
I go back to it more than any other story
in the show's run and just talking

81.23.text: about it makes me want to go and watch it again.

83.20.text: Question 3: Who is your favourite Companion?

86.72.text:
Rory wasn't bumped up to
companion status until the start of series 6

89.71.text:
but I adored his role in the series beforehand.
The journey his character goes on tied with

94.05.text:
the way his story is told is supported brilliantly
by the way the actor Arthur Darvill plays the part.

99.82.text:
He's brave, he's smart, he's a genuinely
good person

103.26.text: and he's the companion I'd most want to be.

105.72.text: Question 4: What was the first Doctor Who story you ever watched?

108.42.text:
I will always remember
this because it was a life changing moment.

111.02.text:
I want to take you back to 2006. I was still
living with my parents... obviously I was

114.97.text:
just a teenager at the time, and then an advert
came on for Doctor Who and Mum said "Oh that's

118.86.text:
a show I used to watch when I was a child.
I was a massive fan I watched it all the way

122.08.text:
from the start. I remember watching the very
first episode." And I thought 'oh yeah great

125.66.text:
cool...sure.' And she was like "George we
should watch it! I reckon you'd really like

128.72.text:
it and it'd be interesting to see what they've
done with it now." Of course this was a parent

131.67.text:
telling me I might like something they used
to watch when they were a kid and I was like

135.57.text:
"eh sure... I don't really care though." And
so we sat down at 7:30 on a Thursday night

140.81.text:
to watch the first episode of the new series
that Prime Television was airing here in New

144.92.text:
Zealand. And that episode was The Christmas
Invasion. And an hour passed, and I watched

148.52.text:
the episode and at the end of it I was pretty
convinced I'd seen the best thing EVER!

152.70.text:
Then what made me even more excited and blew
my mind even more, and I'm still getting excited

157.83.text:
talking about it now, was the fact that I
knew it was going to be on again next week.

162.07.text:
This wasn't a movie this wasn't a one-off,
this was something I was going to get to watch

166.24.text:
for 14 weeks. And now here we are. Mum, thank
you for making me watch that episode.

173.42.text:
Question 5: What is your favourite era or
series?

176.18.text: Whoever came up with this question, I hate you it has been such a hard decision

180.46.text: however if I have to pick a single series of Doctor Who that I adore the most... it is series 6.

185.92.text: Rivalled by the most recent series, series 8.

188.42.text:
But ultimately series 6 has it.
I think it's the most ambitious series of

191.29.text:
Doctor Who ever made. I feel that the writing
and construction of the series story arc has

194.80.text:
never been stronger and I adore the dynamic
of what I call the series 6 ensemble which

198.96.text: is The Doctor, Amy Pond, Rory and River.

201.66.text: Question 6: What is your favourite pre or post regeneration story.

205.12.text: It has to go to The Eleventh Hour. The new production team who

207.31.text: came on at the start of series 5 had a massive mountain to climb. They had to convince the

210.91.text:
massive audience that the show was going to
be just as good even without super popular

215.02.text:
Doctor David Tennant. And I have to admit
when I first saw The Eleventh Hour I was won

218.79.text:
over by the first damn line. What better way
to convince everyone that this Doctor is just

223.13.text:
as awesome as the previous one by getting
him to save the world in 20 minutes.

226.60.text:
Question 7: What is your favourite TARDIS
console design?

229.20.text: The 8th Doctor's TARDIS from the television movie.

231.16.text:
Combining a victorian
aesthetic with an almost steampunk vibe the

234.20.text:
console room is wood and metal and girders
and analog. It is a gorgeous piece of engineering

239.43.text: and it only got to be used once.

241.51.text: Final Question: What is your favourite villain or monster?

244.08.text:
When you've got 50 years of weird
monsters and crazy villains to choose from

247.14.text:
it's incredibly difficult to narrow it down
to just one. But if I had to pick a single

251.06.text:
villain or creature or monster to be my absolute
favourite it would be...

255.32.text: and that's why they're my absolute favourite.

256.70.text: So I hope you enjoyed that 30 minute video and I'll hopefully

259.29.text:
see you again soon. I hope lots of other people
attempt this tag. Something I love about Doctor

262.82.text:
Who is that every viewer responds to it a
little bit differently. We all have different

266.10.text:
opinions and different favourites and it's
great finding out what other people think.

269.59.text:
If you're a fan I hope you enjoy the Christmas
special. If not, there's no better time to
